title: "A One Quality" Brand A font - Sedona Script {BJ Harvey}
content:
Does anyone know which is the font used on the Brand A website: www.brand-a.com   
   
 ![font from Brand A](http://web.archive.org/web/20100212203753im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/1042.gif)
author: anonymous

comments.content:
Is there any place that I can buy that Sedona Script by itself?   
   
Tom

Tom,   
   
Sure, Casady and Greene (aka Fluent Laser Fonts)   
sells Sedona Script individually:   
   
 [http://www.casadyg.com/products/fonts/default4.html?PHPSESSID=cb11b585fdd401c44cf5adfd22f4353d](http://web.archive.org/web/20100212203753/http:/www.casadyg.com/products/fonts/default4.html?PHPSESSID=cb11b585fdd401c44cf5adfd22f4353d)   
   
Stephen

Another place to look for these types of historical faces is Letterhead fonts.   
   
Without too much searching, it looks like Ephemera by Tom Kennedy has the same feel. I'm sure there are more scripts tucked away.   
   
 [http://www.letterheadfonts.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100212203753/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/)   
   
bj
Tough to pin down, but it's likely one of the gothics: Trade Gothic, News Gothic, Alternate Gothic...

bj   
   
Thanks! It is the EXACT font! And I have been wondering for so long...   
   
Anyway while looking for Sedona Script, I found this link about [script fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20100212203753/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/ScriptIDGuide.html).

the script is one of those historical scripts that goes by a bunch of different names.   
   
See Sedona Script   
   
paste the link below into your browser   
and it'll download a pdf.   
   
dl.casadyg.com/misc/fontsinfosheet.pdf   
   
bj
